page.title: 06Kingswood Farm _ Cardinham
page.content: Pests on the farm are crows which are a nuisance and one is shot and hung up to deter other crows in the barley. Rabbits are also shot and there are rats which the cats catch. Mr Dyer has to get up at 6.30 to milk the cows and he usually finishes at 5.30. His son milks the cows in the evening. When they are making silage or hay they all work until dark. Mrs Dyer does all the paperwork, she rears the calves and some lambs in the kitchen. When they are very busy she takes meals to the fields for the workers.
